comment_text: Dear all,

I am following up this case in response to your rejection that MRC Metabolic Diseases Unit (MDU) should not have its own ROR. 

After discussing with colleagues, we believe that the MRC MDU should have its own entry based on the following:

1.	The MRC Epidemiology Unit (EU) which also falls under the Wellcome-MRC Institute of Metabolic Sciences and has its own entry on ROR ([https://ror.org/052578691). This Unit has the same status as the Metabolic Diseases Unit and so if the EU has its own entry then it is logical for MDU to have its own entry as well. 

2.	The MRC MDU is a research organisation in its own right. 

3.	Finally papers published by the unit are mostly in the following format ‘Metabolic Research Laboratories and MRC Metabolic Diseases Unit, Wellcome Trust-MRC Institute of Metabolic Science’. This wording can be found on papers affiliated to the unit via EuropePMC: (https://europepmc.org/search?query=%28AFF%3A%22MRC%20Metabolic%20Diseases%20Unit%22%29&page=1)

I am in the process of ensuring that all MRC units and Institutes are included in the Journal Tracker Tool (https://journalcheckertool.org/). The tool, which pulls data from the Research Organisation Registry, is used by researchers to assess what options they have for publishing in a journal and whether it complies with the UKRI Open Access Policy. Not having an ROR ID excludes researchers at MRC MDU from taking advantage of available tools and puts them at a serious disadvantage compared to their peers at other MRC units.

If there is anything else I can do to provide more evidence, please let me know and I can look into it further.

Kind regards,

Michael Cherrington

Medical Research Council
